description: Job Title:Sr. Data Analytics ConsultantJob DescriptionConcentrix Catalyst is seeking a Sr. Consultant that is part of our Data & Analytics Consulting team.Responsibilities & Duties: Analyze & synthesize insights from surveys, interviews, and workshops, consolidate findings, process mapping, and construct a business facing narrative of results.Understanding of data architecture concepts for business intelligence and artificial intelligence use cases, ability to analyze client data assets.Ability to partner with technical and non-technical teams to discuss technical details and make recommendations.Be able to analyze and reverse engineer digital assets including BI reports, data structures, ETLs, Access databases and Excel files for the purposes of informing recommendations for go forward data strategies.Understand business concepts and performance management strategies. Be able to quickly understand what KPIs and data strategies are most relevant to our clients, who span all business verticals.Leverage market/customer research, trends, and competitor analysis to assist our clients in their data strategies.Perform financial analysis and modeling, as necessary.Be able to estimate scope, duration, and cost of data, BI, & AI initiatives.Provide further insight into the firm’s overall strategy by identifying critical questions and performing ad-hoc analyses, as needed.Qualifications: High level, non-specific business understanding.2 years in any Catalyst relevant vertical or LOB specialization, including Retail, Tech, Telco, Media, Healthcare, Financial Services, & Manufacturing or in Sales, Marketing, or Customer Experience.Strong communication, problem solving, attention to detail, self-managed, communicate effectively with analyst up to director level. Strong writing & interpersonal skills.Ability to partner with Client Engineers, to “go deep” on as-is process & data assets, while utilizing a non-threatening & persuasive approach.Lifetime learner that gains knowledge to increase credibility. Strong presentation & facilitation.2-4 Years, experience with data analysis and/or management consulting.Onshore required.Intermediate to advanced proficiency in communication tools (ie. Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint).Intermediate to advanced proficiency in data tools (ie. SQL and/or BI tool(s) that can be used to analyze client data assets/business perspective).Education:Have a degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Management, Economics, or Statistics, or in a related field. MBA preferred. #ConcentrixCatalystLocation:USA, OR, Work-at-HomeLanguage Requirements:Time Type:Physical & Mental Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to operate a computer, keyboard, telephone, headset, and other office equipment. Work is generally sedentary in nature.If you are a California resident, by submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read and have access to the Job Applicant Privacy Notice for California ResidentsConcentrix is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Disabled/Vets.For more information regarding your EEO rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites: •English•SpanishTo request a reasonable accommodation please click here.If you wish to review the Affirmative Action Plan, please click here.
highlights:
Qualifications:
 Strong communication, problem solving, attention to detail, self-managed, communicate effectively with analyst up to director level, Strong writing & interpersonal skills, Ability to partner with Client Engineers, to “go deep” on as-is process & data assets, while utilizing a non-threatening & persuasive approach, Lifetime learner that gains knowledge to increase credibility, Strong presentation & facilitation.2-4 Years, experience with data analysis and/or management consulting, Onshore required.Intermediate to advanced proficiency in communication tools (ie, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint), Intermediate to advanced proficiency in data tools (ie, SQL and/or BI tool(s) that can be used to analyze client data assets/business perspective).Education:Have a degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Management, Economics, or Statistics, or in a related field, #ConcentrixCatalystLocation:USA, OR, Work-at-HomeLanguage Requirements:Time Type:Physical & Mental Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to operate a computer, keyboard, telephone, headset, and other office equipment, 
Responsibilities:
 Consultant that is part of our Data & Analytics Consulting team, Responsibilities & Duties: Analyze & synthesize insights from surveys, interviews, and workshops, consolidate findings, process mapping, and construct a business facing narrative of results. Understanding of data architecture concepts for business intelligence and artificial intelligence use cases, ability to analyze client data assets, Understand business concepts and performance management strategies, Be able to quickly understand what KPIs and data strategies are most relevant to our clients, who span all business verticals, Leverage market/customer research, trends, and competitor analysis to assist our clients in their data strategies, Perform financial analysis and modeling, as necessary.Be able to estimate scope, duration, and cost of data, BI, & AI initiatives, Provide further insight into the firm’s overall strategy by identifying critical questions and performing ad-hoc analyses, as needed.Qualifications: High level, non-specific business understanding.2 years in any Catalyst relevant vertical or LOB specialization, including Retail, Tech, Telco, Media, Healthcare, Financial Services, & Manufacturing or in Sales, Marketing, or Customer Experience
